DataElement.preferredName: FACT-G Questionnaire Social Family Health Subscale Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Calculated numeric value using the scores from the seven Likert scales included in the Social/Family Well-Being section of the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy General (FACT-G).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-G Questionnaire Score Social Family Health Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._Relating to human society and its members.:A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Relating to human society and its members.
A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DECs released per approval of model owner. mc 10/26/10

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number representing the calculated value of a subscale associated with a FACIT or FACT Questionnaire section.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
